website_summaries.verdict: A cost-effective way to quickly check the three levels most needed to maintain your water balance in a home pool or spa.
pros: A cost-effective way to quickly check the three levels most needed to maintain the water balance in a home pool or spa
The no-bleed test pads produce a uniform color to help increase accuracy
Since there are only three items to consider, the test isn't overly complicated
cons: It can take a little bit of practice to match the test strip colors to the chart
You also might need two containers to get through the summer

customer_reviews.title: Easy & Simple
customer_reviews.text: Purchase Date: 03MAY16 Purchase Price: $7.98 I needed some strips for my pool. Found these strips cheaper on Amazon then the local Leslie's Pool Store. Pool store tested my water for free and strips showed similar results. Follow the directions and you should have no issues. Simple and straight forward. Will buy again. Please Note: I did NOT receive any type of incentive to write this review. This review is my honest opinion after doing much research and purchasing this product for use. Prior to purchasing any product I conduct thorough research. "Was this review helpful to you?" [...]. Thank you! :)
customer_reviews.author: AL

customer_reviews.title: Ok fine they do work
customer_reviews.text: I wrote a one star review just last week and I take it back. The strips work. If your reading is 0 for chlorine go to poolcalculator.com and enter your pool's capacity. It will calculate how much chlorine you have to add. It was much more than I expected. After that I was within acceptable rage and the strips confirmed it. Also when I added baking soda the alkalinity and ph changed almost immediately. They work. Too bad it took half the strips in the tube and a week of frustration for me to be able to figure it out.
customer_reviews.author: Glen P

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE.
customer_reviews.text: First time pool user. I have dumped possibly 6 times too much PH reducer and Muratic Acid in my small 4500 gal pool because I was waiting for the strips to change! The Chlorine bit seems to change. PH and Alkalinity does not. Maybe I have a bad batch... I've had the pool open 2 weeks - (central IL) but ordered these just over a month ago. I can't seem to return this product. BS
customer_reviews.author: J & L Kerr

customer_reviews.title: These do not work, stay away.
customer_reviews.text: These do not work. Ive been using them since last season and thought that my pool was just really low on everything, turns out it wasnt. I had my water tested at a pool store and my ALK was way too high, PH was too high and the strips were telling me that everything was at zero. I recently put 2 bags of Shock It in my pool and less than 2 hours later the strips still show zero chlorine. Im going out tomorrow and get a normal kit that works better than these.
customer_reviews.author: Donna B.

customer_reviews.title: The alkalinity and ph sections of the strip DO NOT ...
customer_reviews.text: The alkalinity and ph sections of the strip DO NOT WORK. No matter what, they are always maxed out one way or the other. I have experimented with about 20 strips trying to get them to say anything different, but I was unsuccessful.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Not worth your money!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these and used them for a week...they are inaccurate. No chlorine was showing in the test when i could literally smell the concentration of chlorine without even being in the pool. Tested the water the same day with another brand and the levels were more on par with what I had expected. I find it hard to believe there is not enough chlorine to get a reading on the strip when I could strongly smell it. The strips were stored inside my house, so there is no chance of them being contaminated prior to use. Very unhappy with product
customer_reviews.author: kara evans

customer_reviews.title: None of the colors match up!
customer_reviews.text: I've used a half dozen brands of test strips over the past 7 years and I must say I am not a fan of these. The bromine level is a shade that is kot on their chart and the ph level isn't either, looking somewhere between a shade of the lowest and the second highest. I've tried different lighting and tested the spa several times over the past 4 days with similar results.
customer_reviews.author: Zachery Lee

customer_reviews.title: accurate enough for a quick check
customer_reviews.text: They're as good or better than any other test strip. Useful for a quick check, not as accurate as the drops / tablets but a lot easier. They'll certainly let you know if the Bromine or pH levels are getting out of bounds. I've used both methods side by side and I feel comfortable using these strips to confirm the hot tub is OK.
customer_reviews.author: Mikey

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: Strips give much different readings than my previous brand. I added Ph up according to test reading with this product, it ended up causing cloudy water because Ph was too high. Using my old brand, adjusted Ph back down and all is well. Bought these because they were a few dollars cheaper, ended up being a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy F

customer_reviews.title: Accurate.
customer_reviews.text: They work. I can test the pool and then get a test done at the pool shop and get the same reading. This saves me trips to the pool shop to determine if I need more chlorine. I'll be buying this again when I am out of strips.
customer_reviews.author: Devoted Amazon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Straight forward- convenient
customer_reviews.text: It’s our first time having a pool this year and it came with some chemicals to balance the water. We decided on these strips since they seemed pretty straight forward. We just dipped them in and got our results immediately. You compare the reading to the colors on the bottle which was super convenient instead of having to keep track of a separate paper. I feel like these will last us a long time, but when it’s time to purchase again we will use this company.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Hurt

customer_reviews.title: Spend a few more bucks and get better quality readings
customer_reviews.text: This will be my last time ordering this product. I thought I'd save money on these strips to check my pool water as the ones I used to get are a few more bucks. When they say you get what you paid for ....this is a good example. Just got them today and put five different strips to the test following the directions. The PH read is totally way off...not even close, so it's a faulty reading. Also, the test pads fell off on on a couple of strips as well. So, I guess I will just use these for the chlorine and alkalinity until they are used up and do a separate PH test with my Taylor kit.
customer_reviews.author: CapeCodAir

customer_reviews.title: Lets just say its nice to know the Chlorine level
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad I bought these. it's my first time having a (blow-up pool) but its still 1,000 gallons. I used a chlorine puck and a dispenser. After only 1 day of the puck floating i took a test with the strip and saw the levels were considered "very high" so I removed the dispenser for a few days. its GREAT PIECE OF MIND!! I do no care so much about the PH level or anything.......but Chlorine can be dangerous.
customer_reviews.author: AnnShamrock

customer_reviews.title: Not Accurate
customer_reviews.text: Just bought these. Unfortunately I didn't read the reviews in more detail. These are NOT accurate at all. Shows same levels for everything. Tap, pool, hot tub, filtered water, bottled water, well water. Its all the same. Ended up dumping a ton of chemicals in my spa based on these results. Took a sample to a pool store and I had WAY too much chemicals in mine. But results said I barely had anything. Stay away.
customer_reviews.author: Pnwrealtor

customer_reviews.title: No pool can go without these
customer_reviews.text: We use above the ground pools during summer for our family, have been using these strips for years and strongly recommend them, it is very important to be aware of the Ph, chlorine and alkalinity for us, we have a little one with special needs so water quality is a plus for us. These strips are super easy to use, just submerge one for a couple of seconds and that's it! First time I used them I tried several strips to , make sure I was understanding the readings and they were pretty close to accuracy every time.
customer_reviews.author: Chatita

customer_reviews.title: Good Value, Easy To Use...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a simple backyard blow up pool for our grand daughter. These are being used along with a chlorine product to maintain a clean and fairly maintenance free pool over the summer. We didn't want to dump and waste the water each time to clean the pool, so we invested in chlorine, these test strips and a small hand skimmer to keep the pool clean and sanitary. For about $50.00 we can have a great backyard pool experience for our grand daughter, and a place for papa and gram, gram to cool off on those hot, lazy days of summer...🌞
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Dreyfous

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these since they were on sale but the strips seemed to be expired🤷‍♂️ They stay the same no matter how much chemicals I put in. Purchased some other strips to compare and found the others more accurate
customer_reviews.author: James Erickson

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate Readings
customer_reviews.text: I received this product last week and kept it in air conditioned house. Right after shocking the pool and smelling strong chlorine in the water, I used one of the strips. Guess what, the chlorine level read zero and had extremely high Ph and Alkaline levels. Have used numerous amounts of strips and the numbers never change. I dumped chemicals in the pool to lower ph and the strips showed extremely high ph numbers right after. No matter what I do to address the ‘problems’ the readings stay the same. Waste of money and time
customer_reviews.author: Miss apple

customer_reviews.title: Works great for Bromine, OK forAlk and does not work at all for pH
customer_reviews.text: I ended up using these for Bromine only, the pH part of the strip bleeds and the colors do not match at all with the colors printed on the container. By these strips when I balance the pH in the pool (at about 7.5) the actual pH measurement with an accurate meter is about 8.5, which causes a lot of problems with the water and causes it to smell terrible. As soon as I switched to using a pH meter to get the water to 7.5 the water was perfect and the smell went away. These strips now say the pH is about 6.5, which is totally useless.
customer_reviews.author: AH

customer_reviews.title: perfect for my Softub Spa
customer_reviews.text: I've tried all sorts of different pool/spa chemical testers over the years. These might not be as accurate as the liquid drops, but to be honest, in a 300 gallon, the chemistry changes rapidly, and these are so incredibly quick & easy to use that I use them much more often than the complicated testing kits. Glad I found them after all of these years, and unless I have some major water problem, I will continue to use them
customer_reviews.author: Myke

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use.
customer_reviews.text: I don't have the proper test gear to check the accuracy of the tests, but know this - the Poolmaster 22211 kit has some excellent features and I don't doubt for a moment that they did their homework in the design department. Simple, just dip a strip, shake off the water and wait for a few minutes for the three test pads on the strip to react to the sample. The color bar readout references are on the side of the plastic container. Read the results in the sunlight so you don't get some odd color light frequencies from LED or other artificial light sources. Could not be simpler to use. Nicely done Poolmaster!
customer_reviews.author: Big Dave

customer_reviews.title: By the other ones
customer_reviews.text: This should really be easy, you dip the strip in your spa or pool, take it out and compare it to the chart on the bottle. First this kit claims that it has four different testing levels and it really only has three. That's incredibly annoying, additionally the alkalinity is never a shade that's even close to anything on their chart. So it's very difficult to know where your levels are. This is just a disappointment, it was only a couple of dollars cheaper so I figured I would give it a chance. I'm sorry that I did.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Miller

customer_reviews.title: Look for other strips
customer_reviews.text: Like many have stated, does not work properly. My chlorine keeps showing it’s super high when the tablets are almost dissolved! It’s had the same reading for weeks. I thought maybe there was actually something wrong with my water? But after coming back to read reviews, I now have realized its probably the strips. The only thing that actually changes is the PH and Alkalinity. But I am also worried that those might be wrong. They brought up the price as well. Purchasing some new strips to compare.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Not even slightly accurate
customer_reviews.text: Not very accurate strips. The chlorine tab never registers anything! Maybe got a bad batch, but its every strip in the container.
customer_reviews.author: Anna M. Bryant

customer_reviews.title: perfect to monitor chlorine, alkalinity and pH your pool
customer_reviews.text: great product - came quickly and i will order more when i run out. i use these about once or twice a week after a chlorine add to make sure that i've got the adjustment correct. now that i know how much chlorine to add to our pool i don't use these as much as i did when i was starting out, but still they are great to have on hand and easy to use and read... we have well water which is alkaline so the alkalinity and pH helped me sort out the amount of chemical i needed to add.
customer_reviews.author: JadeJ

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use. Self explanatory.
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use. You dip in the water for 2 seconds and you just have to match the colors in your strip with the box of the product. It will tell you about alkalinity, chlorine level, etc. Very easy and self explanatory. It is very helpful to see the quality of the water. I use it for our above ground inflatable pool. It is large and has a pump so we treat it with chemicals and I love that these strips help me see if the treatment is enough.
customer_reviews.author: Debora B

customer_reviews.title: These don’t work; potentially dangerous
customer_reviews.text: These don’t work. Results showed (1) no chlorine (2) high alkaline and (3) low ph. Really screwed me up since I’m new to owning a pool. I ended up adding way too much chlorine and also spent $100s on muriatic acid and borax to try to rebalance. At one point the pool got so imbalanced it burned our skin. This ended up being expensive and dangerous quite frankly. I got better more accurate tests and get completely different results and finally got things rebalanced (probably where they were to start).
customer_reviews.author: Joelog

customer_reviews.title: Only test 3 things... not 4
customer_reviews.text: These are easy to use, accurate and easy to read! The little container is durable and these ship fast! This was our first time getting these testing strips. They work great for the three categories on the strip; for those there they test fine. However, The testing strips we normally get test 4 different things not just 3. For the same price we’re going back to our old testing strips.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase... useless
customer_reviews.text: Not all the strips in bottle look the same some already have a tint of color to them, some are all white. We have tested the water in our hot tub numerous times and they never change. First we thought maybe everything is just to low. When I say didn’t change I mean like stayed the same as before we put it in the water. The only time we had anything change color is when we added enough chlorine to literally burn your nose then it turned a light lavender. Anyways... invest in a better brand or something. Just don’t buy these.
customer_reviews.author: J. Combs

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Waste Your Money!!
customer_reviews.text: After adding 27lbs of baking soda to balance the PH I knew there had to be something wrong with these strips. The alkalinity kept getter higher and higher but not the PH. I picked up some strips today from a local store and what do you know? None of the levels, chlorine, alk, or ph match. And the ph is well above 6.8!!! The bottle I got is obviously no good going back. Was just trying to make life easy on myself by purchasing these.
customer_reviews.author: K. Bowman

customer_reviews.title: Must have for the pool
customer_reviews.text: We got a new above ground pool for the summer. it has a pump where you put the chlorine tablet to recycle the water and add the chlorine. This test strip allow me to monitor when to turn off or on the pump so i can control the level of chlorine in the water. it's easy to read, just hold it up next to the bottle. I see other product having 5 or 6 tests, but they are not needed for me.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Son

customer_reviews.title: Misleading description and questionable a accuracy
customer_reviews.text: These are not four-way test strips. They are three-way test strips: chlorine or bromine, alkalinity, and pH. They do not measure hardness as a four-always strip does. Apparently, the manufacturer is counting measuring chlorine or bromine as two tests. Pools/spas only use one or the other (in fact it’s dangerous to mix both).
customer_reviews.author: Adam V. Floyd

customer_reviews.title: Chlorine testing pad always fall off in the water
customer_reviews.text: I’m not sure how accurate these are since I don’t have anything to compare to. I use them with an inflatable pool. The top little square pad always (ALWAYS) falls off in the water(or sometimes is missing altogether) and I need to fish it out of the pool... I think I used these same strips some 5 years ago and they definitely didn’t have this issue.
customer_reviews.author: MooMeow

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!!!! Defective and Dangerous!!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY!!!! THESE DO NOT REGISTER THE BROMINE LEVEL!!! Very dangerous! Pool store said strips should not register chlorine and bromine on same indicator line! These strips said I did not have any bromine. I had plenty of Bromine in my spa after I had my water tested in a pool store.
customer_reviews.author: Gina Z

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is easy to use. But reading it is tricky because sometimes some of the squares you dip in the water has 2 colors or doesn’t color in completely. I found a trick to wait a little longer than recommended to compare the strip to the packaging. I use this and the leslies pool strip 5-in-1 just to make sure the water is good for the lo to use.
customer_reviews.author: RJM

customer_reviews.title: works OK
customer_reviews.text: These are easy to use. But they measure only free chlorine (or bromide), PH, and alkalinity. If you need to measure CYA or hardness, you will need a different product. I do not know how accurate these strips are (I did not take the water to a pool store for a professional measurement), but it seems good enough for home pool use.
customer_reviews.author: David M.

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate
customer_reviews.text: The PH and alkalinity colors don't change. The chlorine strip portion seems to work. Don't buy as these strips are not accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to read, quick and simple test strips
customer_reviews.text: Accurate enough for a small pool or spa, but if you are really serious about your water chemistry, I'd recommend a more advanced kit that can give you a more accurate reading, or test strips that can give you more information like chlorine demand, free chlorine, available chlorine, and stabilizer levels as well. But these provide the basics at least, and the price is right.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley K.

customer_reviews.title: Accurate
customer_reviews.text: They are exactly what we needed for our pool. Was afraid to add chlorine to the pool until we had testers as we didn't want to over or under do it with the chemicals. My only complaint is that the meanings of each section isn't listed anywhere on the package or strips so had to look at the listing to see what each meant
customer_reviews.author: Family shopper

customer_reviews.title: Keep looking for a better product at this price point
customer_reviews.text: The package has indicated that test for four things, but the test strips only have three pads... so the accuracy ?? I had to do me a cross-check but it does seem to be close with the other test strip that I use that measures "total. Active chlorine" , average chlorine , total pH, and alkalinity. These just simply measure chlorine, pH, and alkalinity.
customer_reviews.author: A Name You Can Trust

customer_reviews.title: Defective?
customer_reviews.text: The package I received has to be defective because while the bottom two will change colors the top one just remains white and each strip I’ve tried. Don’t waste your money on this product!
customer_reviews.author: AshleyH

customer_reviews.title: Great pool test strips.
customer_reviews.text: These strips work well. I primarily use them to quickly check the chlorine level in my pool when I don't want to break out the manual test kit. My local pool store stopped selling the cheaper 5-way strips and only sells the more expensive 7-way ones I don't need. These replace the old ones well and are much cheaper. Will purchase again as soon as needed.
customer_reviews.author: TTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because they were a lot cheaper than the ones I usually use. Big mistake. They are only a 3 way strip, not 4 way. Plus the test pads come off in the water. They are accurate (they match the strips I usually use), WHEN the pads don't fall off. Spend a little more and save money in the long run.
customer_reviews.author: Roxief

customer_reviews.title: Nearly flawless
customer_reviews.text: Really easy to use and a great value. The chlorine and alkalinity pads are easy to read. The pH is tough to read above 7.2. I was double-checking the strips with the machine at the pool store, and what looked like 7.2 on the strip was anywhere between 7.0 and 8.4 when I took the samples in. I use the strips for chlorine and alkalinity, and go to the pool store to check pH when the latter gets too high. It's already saved me a ton of money in chemicals.
customer_reviews.author: Rooster

customer_reviews.title: Unclear
customer_reviews.text: These strips are real easy to use and impossibly hard to read. I tried these as an alternative to the full Taylor test kit which is a pain to use but the readings are easy to see. These strips don't provide enough accuracy for people with sensitive skin, so I've got to say they're a no for me.
customer_reviews.author: Allen S.

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: This product does not work the chlorine does not change at all i had to go buy new ones and wasted my money and of course it’s non refundable of course I attempted to use it many many times through out a week adding more chlorine and more chlorine which if you add to much of can hurt you this product failed
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline vega

customer_reviews.title: Not a 4-way test kit
customer_reviews.text: As can be seen in the photo, there are only three test pads: Chlorine/Bromine, Alkalinity, and pH. A true 4-way kit would also include CYA stabilizer - which is what I wanted. Bromine is not another test, it's just another scale on the chlorine test (2X chlorine). If I had looked more closely, I would have seen that this does not include CYA.
customer_reviews.author: Singlespeed

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: These little sticks are excellent to use. Our pool guy normally puts a few drops in the water and watches the colour to determine if we need more chlorine. He has done this for 35 years. So I bought the sticks to see if he is actually getting a correct reading. He was. This is a good and accurate product. It only took 5 seconds to read.
customer_reviews.author: Lorna

customer_reviews.title: The FCL pad is not attached well...
customer_reviews.text: ... i kept finding little white squares floating around my pool. Turns out the pad for the FCL comes lose 4 out of 5 times when you dip this in the water. The results for FCL are not displayed and I just assumed it was 0 the first few times, not realizing the pad was missing.
customer_reviews.author: UVABigM

customer_reviews.title: Best test srips for my spa
customer_reviews.text: I use one of these every day before I enter my spa. My water is very alkaline so I need a lot of PH minus when I change the water, then more after I have added chlorine for a week or two. The chlorine sometimes lasts a day, and sometimes longer depending on how many people have used the spa and how dirty they were. The only way to tell if chlorine or PH minus is needed is by testing. The cost of the test strips is small compared to my health.
customer_reviews.author: Llamadave

customer_reviews.title: inaccurate ph reading.
customer_reviews.text: Very inaccurate readings on first 5 strips I have used. I have been using a liquid test kit, but thought I could save time by using these strips. However, the strips have given very inaccurate readings on ph. Today I did a liquid ph test and got a reading over 7.8. I then used one of the strips and got a reading of 6.8! I could not believe the 6.8 reading, so I took a water sample to Leslie's and they tested the ph at 8.0. Every strip I have used has incorrectly measured the ph.
customer_reviews.author: M.E.141408

customer_reviews.title: so easy!
customer_reviews.text: quick easy and lots in there. love the case, everything is written on the outside for a fast easy read. love them!
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Easy To Use
customer_reviews.text: Yes, easy to get a quick snapshot reading for my pool, spa, and animal water trough. Accurate enough as any test strips. If I want exact reading I always go to my chemical test kit. This does the job inless I am trying to get meticulous for some reason... ph or whatever. Like I said, “Great snap shot of water condition.”
customer_reviews.author: Glen

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with bromine.
customer_reviews.text: Testing hot tub with bromine. The strip kept staying white so I kept adding bromine. Tested with other brand test strip and had too much bromine even though these strips say I have none.
customer_reviews.author: D Loizzo

customer_reviews.title: Good basic test strips!
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed! A basic strip test for our small 3300 gallon pool. I knew it was tasting bitter but our pool was sparkly clear blue, I didn't know why it was so bitter. Got these in the mail and tested our pool. The alk / pH is non existent. And the chlorine is extremely high.
customer_reviews.author: Faith Holbrook

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate and Not Consistent.
customer_reviews.text: The first 5 of 10 test strips worked in registering chemicals by color on the strips. The Chlorine did not register at all on these test strips on 50% of the ones I used. PH showed way low vs 2 other test strips I have. Consistency and innacuracy could have coat a lot of money in chems going by these strips. Save your money!!
customer_reviews.author: HBM008

customer_reviews.title: Terrible, doesn't even read the chlorine at all
customer_reviews.text: The other pads seem somewhat accurate but the chlorine pad doesn't even register any chlorine. Actually test kit confirms adequate chlorine in the pool but these things don't even register its existence. Free Chlorine is probably the most important test and it doesn't even work!
customer_reviews.author: Arakiel

customer_reviews.title: This batch defective..
customer_reviews.text: I've used these for years. They worked great until this recent batch is bad. The strips dont change color. We kept adding chlorine thinking our spas chemistry was off. Turns out it's the bad strips. I had these on hand for backup and the return window is closed by the time we opened. If you get these open right away to make sure they work.
customer_reviews.author: Parsons Fam

customer_reviews.title: Easy and Accurate
customer_reviews.text: These test strips produce the same results as my 5-way reagent test kit, so that leads me to believe they are accurate. Super easy to use, instant results, nice container, easy to read table on the side of the container. Great value. I will purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Keep it simple stupid ! 😂
customer_reviews.text: These get 5 stars for price and ease of use. The strips test for the 3 important things for an average above ground pool. They test for free chlorine or bromine, ph, and alkalinity. If you have an above ground pool these are all you need. I wasted a lot of money trying to add chemicals that other test strips/drops measured low and high levels of this or that. For above grounds pools, your better off just testing with these three way chlorine or bromine, ph, and alkalinity test strips. Otherwise your gonna be adding other chemicals constantly that you dont need and your pool is never going to be clear.
customer_reviews.author: Mykle Mesecar

customer_reviews.title: Accurate, good price
customer_reviews.text: I only use this to test chlorine and use a digital device for pH. These are a good buy. Easy to read by color intensity. Only reads chlorine, alk, and pH, not calcium hardness. I use this on my hot tub. Accurate and consistent to my usage. Better than the price in spa shops in Alaska, they gouge ya cause we are limited in pool/spa resources.
customer_reviews.author: Devon

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate.
customer_reviews.text: This is not accurate at all. Way off on Ph and alkaline levels. You could only rely on FCI. I found out after i got my water tested at a pool supplies store. Its ok for FCI checks. I would suggest weekly water test at pool supply store ( free).
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Demirci

customer_reviews.title: Very simple and accurate
customer_reviews.text: We have a blow up kids pool about 200 gals so I use the Clorox recipe for keeping the well water from forming that clear slippery algae and these strips work great at making sure I have ENOUGH but not too much.
customer_reviews.author: Sheilags

customer_reviews.title: Great for pool owners!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Easy to use. Follow the directions and store in a cool dry place.
customer_reviews.author: Paige

customer_reviews.title: East to read pool water test strips - allows dbl check of pool store readings.
customer_reviews.text: I have my water tested at the pool store. Sometimes their reading seems way off. I use these to double check. Techs who are new or see colors differently can give you the wrong readings. This can cause you to add more chemicals than needed and throw your whole pool water out of kilter.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I just bought a home with a hot tub in the backyard and the previous owner left me a set of test strips that looked a bit too old to be still effective. In fact, as soon as I tried these new ones, I immediately got a whole different reading (especially for the clorine/bromine levels). These strips are also easier to use: just dip them in the water for two seconds and then read the colors, comparing to the label on the product. Easy.
customer_reviews.author: Corrado

customer_reviews.title: easy to use , relatively accurate
customer_reviews.text: I have used Poolmaster 22211 Smart Test a few times and it is easy to use and read. I also checked it with our pool guy's chemistry test devise and the results were almost the same.
customer_reviews.author: Omid

customer_reviews.title: Quick no brainer
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your time with a kit and filling the vile to the correct level, figuring out which bottle and how many drops, then trying to figure out what color you have....dip these babies in and see immediately and accurately which color matches the scale on the side. It's faster than writing this review, while buddy over there has just finished guessing what his alkalinity is and now is going to test his ph.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Bell

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: As advertised. Maybe I'm just a little bit picky but sometimes I'm wet and my hand is wet and getting one of the little strips out of the container without getting the rest of them wet isn't the easiest thing oh whatever it works fine
customer_reviews.author: Peter Cantin

customer_reviews.title: A lot easier to use than other kits
customer_reviews.text: I can’t really vouch for its accuracy yet because I’m new to taking care of a pool and I HAVE NO IDEA WHAT I’M DOING. I’m not sure I would even know if it’s wrong until I take a water sample to my local store to have if checked again but it’s easy to use and we test the pool often, adjusting accordingly. I tried other kits but this one is the easiest and quickest. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: MelissaD

customer_reviews.title: Fast Testing - 2 seconds and acccurate.  I like that
customer_reviews.text: These strips come in a sturdy container that is easy to open and extract 1 strip. The test strips respond quickly and the results are very close to the same as my local spa test results as well. I will definitely buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Asplund

customer_reviews.title: Easiest water test ever!
customer_reviews.text: We have had a pool for years and I have always struggled to keep the chemicals balanced. I have used the water tubes and different drops to see how our water is and always end up with a green water. I have been using these strips once a week and then just adjust chemicals as needed! So easy!
customer_reviews.author: Autumn

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy these!
customer_reviews.text: The strips are stored in a cool dry place, but they seem to have gone bad and give us the same reading everyday. We can tell the chlorine is high we've owned this pool for over a year now and the strips don't indicate that Would not purchase these again.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany Schultz

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and easy to compare to the chart on the side of the bottle. Just wish that sold 100 packs and not just 50. I have a pool and hot tub that has to be checked multiple times a week so I go through these fast.
customer_reviews.author: Cappie Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Great for chlorine
customer_reviews.text: These work great. I compare the readings of chlorine against another strip brand and get similar readings, so it seems accurate. I don’t pay too much attention to the other tests on it honestly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -Inexpensive -Nice little bottle to keep them in -Quick and easy to use Cons: -Only runs a few test. I like them and will keep using them
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Vickers

customer_reviews.title: Too late to return
customer_reviews.text: So I’m giving 3s across the board because several of my test strips are missing the bottom tabs.... last of the run maybe? The ones with all the tabs work well. I’m sure this isn’t common; I bought them because of the good reviews. Got busy and I missed my window to return them.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Accuracy?
customer_reviews.text: These go in the water and give me a range in which the water is at. Is it accurate? I don't know. I can't calibrate it. But they are priced right and tell me what I need to know - If i need to add sanitizer or pH up.
customer_reviews.author: brewmaistro

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I hate using drops for measurements of pool water.... This is so much easier...and I would say it is just a bit ( under and over) for accuracy....yeah! Not too technical but it's what I know
customer_reviews.author: Dennis B.

customer_reviews.title: Fall apart
customer_reviews.text: There are only three pads on each strip that tests the water levels. The top one tests chlorine. About 1/3 of the time, just gently dipping it into the water according to the instructions, made the pad fall off into the pool. Using a second test trip 1/3 of the time made these costly and frustrating. I found another brand at a big box hardware store and they are much higher quality for less money per strip.
customer_reviews.author: cguppie

customer_reviews.title: Works like it should!
customer_reviews.text: These are easy to use and work as advertised! Truly, I can't speak to the "accuracy", as I have no baseline...but they tell me when the chlorine is low and that is a win for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey L.

customer_reviews.title: Easier than reagents
customer_reviews.text: Strips are easier than reagents and seem just as accurate. Seems like a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: TheConnoisseur

customer_reviews.title: Decent test strips but not the best
customer_reviews.text: So far they seem to work well and let me know what needs to be done. Sometimes it's a bit difficult to figure out what color to test strip is compared to the color key. I've also had several of the pads fall right off the strip when I dip it into the water. I think next time I'll try a different brand. I'm not overly impressed with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: ImJoeMan

customer_reviews.title: Not the best
customer_reviews.text: After reading reviews on other sites I thought I would give these a try. Very disappointing. The individual pads almost fell apart within seconds of dipping in the pool. The colors were weak and indistinct. Nothing you could use to match up against the chart. I would not buy these again nor would I recommend them to anyone else.
customer_reviews.author: Robert H.

customer_reviews.title: defect
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 4 times first three were ok no problems 4th test kit problem with test squares falling off once placed in water have 30 or so left will consider another brand. Cannot find a way to contact seller to find out why have problem.
customer_reviews.author: Philip J

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and good for small size pool. Don’t need all the complicated reading the others has. Just need to make sure the alkaline/ph and chlorine is at the right level for a small size pool
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Yeh

customer_reviews.title: The strips are easy to read, all you have to do is dip about 6 inches under water for 2-3 seconds
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, good price! The 4 way combo testing strips makes it easy to maintain my pool proper water chemistry. The strips are easy to read, all you have to do is dip about 6 inches under water for 2-3 seconds then shake excess water off and compare color shades to diagram of acceptable ranges on the bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Jaco

customer_reviews.title: Great product for daily testing
customer_reviews.text: They’re ok, but when I compare this test to the water testing at the pool supply store, the pool supply stores is a little more accurate on the chlorine levels.
customer_reviews.author: Mama Bear Bethay

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use! Accurate readings! Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Convenient and easy to use! Much better than the liquid testing chemicals and I feel these are more accurate personally. The strips have results right away the liquid testing chemicals take 10 minutes for a result, so huge difference! Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Corinne P.

customer_reviews.title: Work great!
customer_reviews.text: Our well water has had to be shocked with chlorine due to contamination. I have been using these test strips to find out if the chlorine is still there after the shockings and what at level it is present so I can treat the water to use in my aquarium and for the plants (I am still using bottled water for drinking and cooking as we have yet to get rid of the contamination). The strips work great, I use one to test for the level of chlorine and then another after I treat the water to remove the chlorine and the strips work instantly giving me the information I need.
customer_reviews.author: brother bruno

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Accurate
customer_reviews.text: Very easy and clear to read. 2 seconds is all it takes. You end up using 2 each time, one to see where you are starting and one to see if you balanced you chemicals properly. The guide on the side of the container makes it easy to understand your water even without any background knowledge.
customer_reviews.author: Magda Burzynski

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: For me these are the best pool water tester it’s really easy to read and the color matches the bottle color code. Also the colors on the strip does bleed off like some of the others. I am going to buy a second one.
customer_reviews.author: Ng

customer_reviews.title: Not what i paid for- Got 3-way test kit instead of 4-way and it does not work either
customer_reviews.text: This kit test only 3 things, 1. Free chlorine, 2.pH, 3.Bromine and not 4-way as advertised. I opened without realizing it is not what I paid for? The strips do not color properly and most part of it stays white making it very difficult to match colors for reading. I purchased this after reading all the great reviews, not sure if the reviews are mixed up with reviews for another kit. I am writing this review only to warn future buyers to check if you got the kit you paid for before opening and this is not a good kit to maintain your spa or pool. I will not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: CL

customer_reviews.title: Easy
customer_reviews.text: You get the readings in literally seconds and they're easy to read: the colors you get match the pad, so you get a pretty accurate idea of your ph and ak levels in your spa.
customer_reviews.author: S. T. Martinez De Simon

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and read
customer_reviews.text: Got the job done all summer. Only had to change the water in our above ground pool once this summer. This made managing our pool much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea R.

customer_reviews.title: Good Product, Great Price!
customer_reviews.text: Good Product, Great Price! Arrived quick, good value for the money Good pool add-on specially for small 10-15ft pools
customer_reviews.author: Justo Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: Do not work properly
customer_reviews.text: These strips never changed color. I used nearly the whole package trying to get the chemicals correct in my hot tub. I missed the window for returns by 1 day. These do not work properly.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie R

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use ! The price is awsome! If you need it just buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Haley Hokanson

customer_reviews.title: i didnt use it for a pool
customer_reviews.text: my vet said to check the ph level on my mares milk to find out how close to foaling, when it drops to 5.8 she is close I found it accurate and so did a friend
customer_reviews.author: PAM WILSON

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use but not sure how accurate they are
customer_reviews.text: They are very easy to use. Literally takes a couple of seconds. However I don't know how accurate they are. I assume they are accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Poolmaster 22211 Smart Test 4-Way Swimming Pool and Spa Water Chemistry Test Strips, 50 count (Pack of 1)
product_meta.description:
Poolmaster's Swimming Pool Collections consist of the essential must-have products for customary pool and spa maintenance, constructed with durable materials designed to keep your pool sparkling. For maintaining your swimming pool or spa's water chemistry, Poolmaster's 4-Way Test Strips are a great choice. The bottle features an easy-to-read color chart and strips have no-bleed pads for accurate color reading results. Tests for chlorine, bromine, pH and total alkalinity. Includes 50 test strips.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Since 1958, Poolmaster has been a leading manufacturer of aftermarket pool and spa products with an unwavering commitment to quality, service and reliability. Poolmaster offers products across six different product lines- Backyard and Decor, Inflatables, Floats, Maintenance, Swim and Dive, and Toys and Games. Poolmaster - We Make Water Fun!
feature_bullets: For maintaining healthy water chemistry in swimming pool or spa
Analyzes four chemical factors; free chlorine, bromine, alkalinity and pH
Dip in water for instant reading; no-bleed pads give accurate color reading

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping. Learn More
